verses.text: Paul and Timotheus, the servants of Jesus Christ, to all the saints in Christ Jesus which are at Philippi, with the bishops and deacons:

similars.text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:
Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timotheus our brother,

Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:
Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:
Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timothy our brother, unto the church of God which is at Corinth, with all the saints which are in all Achaia:

Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, and Timotheus our brother,
Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, to the saints which are at Ephesus, and to the faithful in Christ Jesus:

verses.text: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.

similars.text: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be with you, mercy, and peace, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.
To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ which are at Colosse: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,
Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, be with you all. Amen.

And may the grace of God the Father, whose throne is high in the heavens, and our Lord Jesus Christ, who sitteth on the right hand of his power, until all things shall become subject unto him, be, and abide with you forever. Amen.

Paul, and Silvanus, and Timotheus, unto the church of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and in the Lord Jesus Christ: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
Unto Timothy, my own son in the faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God our Father and Jesus Christ our Lord.
The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
And this according to the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, to whom be all glory, both now and forever. Amen.
Grace be with you all. Amen.
And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
And the very God of peace sanctify you wholly; and I pray God your whole spirit and soul and body be preserved blameless unto the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.
Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
Now unto God and our Father be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.
Now God himself and our Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, direct our way unto you.
Then said Jesus to them again, Peace be unto you: as my Father hath sent me, even so send I you.
And the peace of God, which passeth all understanding, shall keep your hearts and minds through Christ Jesus.
Now our Lord Jesus Christ himself, and God, even our Father, which hath loved us, and hath given us everlasting consolation and good hope through grace,
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy: for I am the Lord your God.

And now, I would commend you to seek this Jesus of whom the prophets and apostles have written, that the grace of God the Father, and also the Lord Jesus Christ, and the Holy Ghost, which beareth record of them, may be and abide in you forever. Amen.
Mercy unto you, and peace, and love, be multiplied.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who hath blessed us with all spiritual blessings in heavenly places in Christ:
Blessed be God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of mercies, and the God of all comfort;
We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,

I am mindful of you always in my prayers, continually praying unto God the Father in the name of his Holy Child, Jesus, that he, through his infinite goodness and grace, will keep you through the endurance of faith on his name to the end.
The Lord our God be with us, as he was with our fathers: let him not leave us, nor forsake us:
But grow in grace, and in the knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To him be glory both now and for ever. Amen.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
John to the seven churches which are in Asia: Grace be unto you, and peace, from him which is, and which was, and which is to come; and from the seven Spirits which are before his throne;
Therefore being justified by faith, we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:
Greet ye one another with a kiss of charity. Peace be with you all that are in Christ Jesus. Amen.
All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
Glory, and honor, and power, and might,Be ascribed to our God; for he is full of mercy,Justice, grace and truth, and peace,Forever and ever, Amen.
So that I come again to my father's house in peace; then shall the Lord be my God:
Elect according to the foreknowledge of God the Father, through sanctification of the Spirit, unto obedience and sprinkling of the blood of Jesus Christ: Grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.

And now, may the peace of God rest upon you, and upon your houses and lands, and upon your flocks and herds, and all that you possess, your women and your children, according to your faith and good works, from this time forth and forever. And thus I have spoken. Amen.
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,
Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you and peace from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you, and peace, from God our Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be to you and peace from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
Grace unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be with you, mercy, and peace, from God the Father, and from the Lord Jesus Christ, the Son of the Father, in truth and love.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
Grace and peace be multiplied unto you through the knowledge of God, and of Jesus our Lord,
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.
To the saints and faithful brethren in Christ which are at Colosse: Grace be unto you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
Peace be to the brethren, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, and the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Ghost, be with you all. Amen.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
And this according to the grace of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, to whom be all glory, both now and forever. Amen.

And may the grace of God the Father, whose throne is high in the heavens, and our Lord Jesus Christ, who sitteth on the right hand of his power, until all things shall become subject unto him, be, and abide with you forever. Amen.
To all that be in Rome, beloved of God, called to be saints: Grace to you and peace from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be with you all. Amen.
Grace be with all them that love our Lord Jesus Christ in sincerity. Amen.
Brethren, the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
We give thanks to God and the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, praying always for you,
To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
That the name of our Lord Jesus Christ may be glorified in you, and ye in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.

verses.text: I thank my God upon every remembrance of you,

similars.text: I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;
I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;
Behold, my beloved brethren, remember the words of your God; pray unto him continually by day, and give thanks unto his holy name by night. Let your hearts rejoice.
I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;
I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;
I thank my God always on your behalf, for the grace of God which is given you by Jesus Christ;

verses.text: Always in every prayer of mine for you all making request with joy,

similars.text: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
And all things, whatsoever ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye shall receive.
We give thanks to God always for you all, making mention of you in our prayers;
And, as it is written--Whatsoever ye shall ask in faith, being united in prayer according to my command, ye shall receive.
Be pleased, O Lord, to deliver me: O Lord, make haste to help me.
I will bless the Lord at all times: his praise shall continually be in my mouth.
Giving thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every side.

verses.text: For your fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now;
Being confident of this very thing, that he which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ:

similars.text: For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence steadfast unto the end;

verses.text: Even as it is meet for me to think this of you all, because I have you in my heart; inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defence and confirmation of the gospel, ye all are partakers of my grace.

similars.text: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
And Paul said, I would to God, that not only thou, but also all that hear me this day, were both almost, and altogether such as I am, except these bonds.
And it shall come to pass, that inasmuch as they are faithful, and exercise faith in me, I will pour out my Spirit upon them in the day that they assemble themselves together.
And this I do for the gospel's sake, that I might be partaker thereof with you.
As also ye have acknowledged us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even as ye also are ours in the day of the Lord Jesus.

verses.text: For God is my record, how greatly I long after you all in the bowels of Jesus Christ.
And this I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;

similars.text: For this cause we also, since the day we heard it, do not cease to pray for you, and to desire that ye might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;
Therefore, as ye abound in every thing, in faith, and utterance, and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that ye abound in this grace also.

verses.text: That ye may approve things that are excellent; that ye may be sincere and without offence till the day of Christ;

similars.text: That ye might walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;
For he that in these things serveth Christ is acceptable to God, and approved of men.
For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be refused, if it be received with thanksgiving:

verses.text: Being filled with the fruits of righteousness, which are by Jesus Christ, unto the glory and praise of God.

similars.text: (For the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)
The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.
Say unto the righteous that it is well with them; for they shall eat the fruit of their doings.
Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall ye be my disciples.
He loveth righteousness and judgment: the earth is full of the goodness of the Lord.
He that is faithful, the same shall be kept and blessed with much fruit.

verses.text: But I would ye should understand, brethren, that the things which happened unto me have fallen out rather unto the furtherance of the gospel;

similars.text: And now, my son, I have somewhat to say concerning the restoration of which has been spoken; for behold, some have wrested the scriptures, and have gone far astray because of this thing. And I perceive that thy mind has been worried also concerning this thing. But behold, I will explain it unto thee.

And now, my beloved brethren, for ye are my brethren, and ye ought to be beloved, and ye ought to bring forth works which are meet for repentance, seeing that your hearts have been grossly hardened against the word of God, and seeing that ye are a lost and a fallen people.

And now, I say unto you, my brethren, that after ye have known and have been taught all these things, if ye should transgress and go contrary to that which has been spoken, that ye do withdraw yourselves from the Spirit of the Lord, that it may have no place in you to guide you in wisdom's paths that ye may be blessed, prospered, and preserved--

verses.text: So that my bonds in Christ are manifest in all the palace, and in all other places;
And many of the brethren in the Lord, waxing confident by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the word without fear.

similars.text: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

And now my beloved brethren, I have spoken these words unto you according to the Spirit which testifieth in me; and my soul doth exceedingly rejoice, because of the exceeding diligence and heed which ye have given unto my word.
And now, Lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy servants, that with all boldness they may speak thy word,

verses.text: Some indeed preach Christ even of envy and strife; and some also of good will:
The one preach Christ of contention, not sincerely, supposing to add affliction to my bonds:

similars.text: Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, even unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.

And this I do that I may establish my gospel, that there may not be so much contention; yea, Satan doth stir up the hearts of the people to contention concerning the points of my doctrine; and in these things they do err, for they do wrest the scriptures and do not understand them.
For though I preach the gospel, I have nothing to glory of: for necessity is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the gospel!
Yea, so have I strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build upon another man's foundation:
And whoso is not willing to lay down his life for my sake is not my disciple.
My disciples, in days of old, sought occasion against one another and forgave not one another in their hearts; and for this evil they were afflicted and sorely chastened.

verses.text: But the other of love, knowing that I am set for the defence of the gospel.
What then? notwithstanding, every way, whether in pretence, or in truth, Christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice.

similars.text: Wherefore, he that preacheth and he that receiveth, understand one another, and both are edified and rejoice together.
Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.
Rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth;
And my soul shall be joyful in the Lord: it shall rejoice in his salvation.

verses.text: For I know that this shall turn to my salvation through your prayer, and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

similars.text: I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the Lord.
Make haste to help me, O Lord my salvation.

But we are bound to give thanks alway to God for you, brethren beloved of the Lord, because God hath from the beginning chosen you to salvation through sanctification of the Spirit and belief of the truth:

And I know that the Lord God will consecrate my prayers for the gain of my people. And the words which I have written in weakness will be made strong unto them; for it persuadeth them to do good; it maketh known unto them of their fathers; and it speaketh of Jesus, and persuadeth them to believe in him, and to endure to the end, which is life eternal.

And take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of my Spirit, which I will pour out upon you, and my word which I reveal unto you, and be agreed as touching all things whatsoever ye ask of me, and be faithful until I come, and ye shall be caught up, that where I am ye shall be also. Amen.
Turn you at my reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known my words unto you.

verses.text: According to my earnest expectation and my hope, that in nothing I shall be ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also Christ shall be magnified in my body, whether it be by life, or by death.

similars.text: Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.
Therefore, blessed is my servant Warren, for I will have mercy on him; and, notwithstanding the vanity of his heart, I will lift him up inasmuch as he will humble himself before me.

verses.text: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.

similars.text: For whether we live, we live unto the Lord; and whether we die, we die unto the Lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the Lord's.
Therefore now, O Lord, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live.

verses.text: But if I live in the flesh, this is the fruit of my labour: yet what I shall choose I wot not.

similars.text: The labour of the righteous tendeth to life: the fruit of the wicked to sin.

verses.text: For I am in a strait betwixt two, having a desire to depart, and to be with Christ; which is far better:
Nevertheless to abide in the flesh is more needful for you.

similars.text: So then they that are in the flesh cannot please God.

verses.text: And having this confidence, I know that I shall abide and continue with you all for your furtherance and joy of faith;

similars.text: And now, my son, I trust that I shall have great joy in you, because of your steadiness and your faithfulness unto God; for as you have commenced in your youth to look to the Lord your God, even so I hope that you will continue in keeping his commandments; for blessed is he that endureth to the end.
I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all things.
Uphold me according unto thy word, that I may live: and let me not be ashamed of my hope.
For the Lord shall be thy confidence, and shall keep thy foot from being taken.
For we are made partakers of Christ, if we hold the beginning of our confidence steadfast unto the end;
And it is my will that you shall humble yourselves before me, and obtain this blessing by your diligence and humility and the prayer of faith.
Yea, and if I be offered upon the sacrifice and service of your faith, I joy, and rejoice with you all.
I have confidence in you through the Lord, that ye will be none otherwise minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear his judgment, whosoever he be.
I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy righteous judgments.
Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
And now, my brethren, I would speak unto you more; but on the morrow I will declare unto you the remainder of my words. Amen.
But I trust in the Lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

And now my beloved brethren, I have spoken these words unto you according to the Spirit which testifieth in me; and my soul doth exceedingly rejoice, because of the exceeding diligence and heed which ye have given unto my word.

Therefore, be not afraid of your enemies, for I have decreed in my heart, saith the Lord, that I will prove you in all things, whether you will abide in my covenant, even unto death, that you may be found worthy.
And now I come to that faith, of which I said I would speak; and I will tell you the way whereby ye may lay hold on every good thing.
We are confident, I say, and willing rather to be absent from the body, and to be present with the Lord.
I rejoice therefore that I have confidence in you in all things.

verses.text: That your rejoicing may be more abundant in Jesus Christ for me by my coming to you again.

similars.text: That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.
I sent him therefore the more carefully, that, when ye see him again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.
Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and come again unto you. If ye loved me, ye would rejoice, because I said, I go unto the Father: for my Father is greater than I.
Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say, Rejoice.
That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.

verses.text: Only let your conversation be as it becometh the gospel of Christ: that whether I come and see you, or else be absent, I may hear of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind striving together for the faith of the gospel;

similars.text: And this I do for the gospel's sake, that I might be partaker thereof with you.
Hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me, in faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

verses.text: And in nothing terrified by your adversaries: which is to them an evident token of perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of God.
For unto you it is given in the behalf of Christ, not only to believe on him, but also to suffer for his sake;
Having the same conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear to be in me.
